snippet: New York City members of Project Healing Waters Fly Fishing, a nonprofit that uses the sport as rehabilitative therapy for veterans, meet twice a month to build rods, tie flies, make friends and go fishing.
abstract: New York City members of Project Healing Waters Fly Fishing, a nonprofit that uses the sport as rehabilitative therapy for veterans, meet twice a month to build rods, tie flies, make friends and go fishing.
lead_paragraph: Todd Ford whisked back his fly-fishing rod, and then flung it forward, the plastic line slicing through the air. He might have been in Montana, if not for a distinctly urban scene: a view of One World Trade Center, Coney Island’s Wonder Wheel and the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge, as tankers cruised through Lower New York Bay.

headline.main: Casting a Lifeline to Disabled Veterans
